intro: Bugranopsis salzmanniana, commonly known as the Salzmann's bugranopsis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, providing protection against strong winds and sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
